name: Echidna
food: Insects such as ants and termites, beetle larvae and worms
description: Echidnas, also called spiny anteaters, are egg-laying mammals known for their spiny bodies and unique nose. They are monotremes like the platypus.

name: Tasmanian Devil
food: Meat from animals such as wallabies and wombats
description: A carnivorous marsupial found in Tasmania, known for its screech and strong bite. It's the largest living carnivorous marsupial.

name: Quokka
description: Small marsupial known for its friendly smile. Found on Rottnest Island, it resembles a tiny wallaby.
found: Rottnest Island and parts of Western Australia

name: Frill-necked Lizard
description: A lizard that opens its frilled neck and hisses when threatened. Found in Northern Australia.

name: Hawksbill Turtle
description: A sea turtle with a beak-like mouth and overlapping shell scutes. Common in tropical coasts.
found: Tropical coasts of Queensland, NT, WA

name: Perentie
description: Australia's largest monitor lizard. Shy and found in deserts. Revered in Aboriginal culture.

name: Cassowary
description: Large flightless bird with powerful legs. Can swim and run fast. Dangerous when provoked.

name: Kookaburra
description: Known for its 'laughing' call, the kookaburra is the largest kingfisher species in Australia.

name: Yellow-tailed Black Cockatoo
description: Black cockatoo with yellow cheek patches and tail band. Found in forests of southeast Australia.
